item.title: Exclusive MTG Spider-Man Spoilers (Card Reveals)
item.content:encoded:
We're swinging from the rooftops with excitement for the upcoming Magic: The Gathering Universes Beyond Spider-man set, and we're thrilled to have the official spoilers for two brand Bonus Sheet cards - straight from our friends at Wizards of the Coast! Let's jump right in.

MTG Spider-Man - Rest In Peace

Graveyard hate has never looked this good! Featuring original artwork from this pivotal moment in the comics by Mark Buckingham and D'Isreali (from Spectacular Spider-Man #27 (2003)), I can't think of a single better moment to illustrate this card.

And with this full-art treatment, the art truly gets to shine as we see Peter Parker at his beloved Uncle Ben's grave. Your opponents running a mono-black sacrifice deck will also hold their head in their hands when you drop this on the battlefield.

Now, onto our next card - which brings a bit of delightful chaos to the scene.

MTG Spider-Man - Rite of Replication

This iconic artwork, showing a horde of Spider-Man clones bursting onto the frame, is the perfect piece to choose to represent Rite of Replication, a sorcery allowing you to clone (or, if kicked, clone and clone and clone) a creature on the battlefield. Once again, the full-art of these bonus sheet treatments really adds a lot of energy and chaos to this card.

I'm a big fan of copying creatures, and I've always loved the way Rite of Replication doesn't restrict you to copying a creature you control. Does your opponent have an annoying Commander? Give them a taste of their own medicine! 

What do you think of these two Bonus Sheet cards? Do you think they chose the right artwork to represent them? Let us know in the comments below!

Giaco Furino joined the TechRaptor team as a Staff Writer in 2019 after searching for a dedicated place to write and talk about Tabletop Games. In 2020, heâ€¦ More about Giaco
